page.title: 12Pits and Ponds in Whitley
page.content: There are many different sizes of pits and ponds in Whitley and they are a great feature in the landscape of the village. The larger ones were started by local{sand}extracting firms in 1936 After 24 years of use the last lorry loads left in the 1960's.Over 80 acres of farm land was lost,many were filled with water or rubbish. Lately the largest rubbish tip has been reclaimed by the council and it is now good farming land again. The small pits were often dug out by farmers for marl to fertilise the land The side walls were sometimes blown down by dynamite. After the nineteenth century most marl pits were out of use because farmers found lime a better fertiliser.Some clay was used for the canals and some for bricks. The pits were used by children for swimming. Most are now fishing ponds or derelict
